abstract: New York City police officers fill streets to pay their respects to slain colleague Wenjian Liu, as hundreds turn their backs on Mayor Bill de Blasio during eulogy in silent protest; action follows similar display at funeral of Officer Rafael Ramos, showing a persistent willingness by rank and file to disregard their leadership; protest is in defiance of explicit request by Commissioner William J Bratton and comes amid de facto work slowdown by officers across city.
lead_paragraph: The snub by many uniformed officers watching the funeral of Officer Wenjian Liu in Brooklyn showed a willingness by the rank and file to disregard their leadership.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Annie Correal, Jia Guo, Nate Schweber and Jeffrey E. Singer.
byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and KIRK SEMPLE

snippet: The snub by many uniformed officers watching the funeral of Officer Wenjian Liu in Brooklyn showed a willingness by the rank and file to disregard their leadership.

headline.main: Another Silent Protest of Mayor de Blasio as Officer Liu Is Laid to Rest
headline.print_headline: Silent Protest as 2nd Officer Is Laid to Rest
